text: So I have to bring up this relatively minor pet peeve of mine... Why in the world are there two layers of "edit" clicking when editing a CTA? First in the list, you click "edit" then it brings it up as a single item... then you have to click edit again. Just... why?!
my general assumption would be in case you have multiple variations of the CTA like so:
Welp. That would make total sense <@U2H3TT8F2> -- just is not something that registers when there isn't a variation
`override_inherited_src=True` does not seem to be working initially on the default `@HubSpot/logo` module. On coded theme templates it shows the portal default logo.

For anyone that might try searching something similar to what I tried to ask and search for, to no avail, earlier on - making a simple POST request via Zapierâ€™s Custom Code functionality using fetch:

InputData.sponsor_id that can be found in the request body in this case is info captured via webhook in HubSpot in an earlier step. Note how it is entered in the input fields provided by Zapier above the code.

This allows me to make a query to find a contact with a property value matching inputData.sponsor_id. I now plan to take the returned contact object data and associate it to the object initially pulled in through the webhook.

 Hopefully this saves someone a few hours of fumbling around.
